title: Federal Loan Simulator - Simulate Borrowing More - User Data
description: User data required to execute the Federal Student Aid Loan Simulator for borrowing more money for college. IMPORTANT: current_loans are the NEW loans you want to simulate borrowing, not existing loans. These represent the loan mix you want to borrow to cover the borrow_amount. For dependent undergrads, use a mix of Direct Subsidized, Direct Unsubsidized (up to annual limits), and Parent PLUS loans to cover remaining gap. For independent/graduate students, use Direct Graduate Unsubsidized and Grad PLUS loans. Look up current federal interest rates and annual borrowing limits to determine appropriate values.
$comment: LOAN STRATEGY CONSTRUCTION GUIDE: When a user asks 'what loans should I take' or 'help me figure out the loan situation', YOU must construct the optimal current_loans array automatically. DO NOT ask the user to specify loan types - you are the expert. FEDERAL LOAN LIMITS FOR DEPENDENT UNDERGRADS: Freshman=$5,500 ($3,500 subsidized + $2,000 unsubsidized), Sophomore=$6,500 ($4,500+$2,000), Junior/Senior=$7,500 ($5,500+$2,000). CRITICAL: Direct PLUS Loan for Parents has NO LIMIT - use it to fill any gap beyond direct student loan limits. CURRENT RATES (2024-25): Direct Subsidized=5.50%, Direct Unsubsidized (undergrad)=6.53%, Direct PLUS (parent/grad)=9.08%. STRATEGY: Always max out cheaper student loans first, then use Parent PLUS for remainder. Example for $40K freshman need: [{type:Direct Subsidized,rate:5.5,balance:3500}, {type:Direct Unsubsidized,rate:6.53,balance:2000}, {type:Direct PLUS Loan for Parents,rate:9.08,balance:34500}]. The sum of all loan_balance values MUST equal borrow_amount.

program_timing.description: Whether borrowing for current or future program

program_type.description: Type of degree or program (e.g., Bachelor's degree, Master's degree)

dependency_status.description: Whether student is dependent (supported by parents) or independent

school_location.description: State where the school is located (optional, full state name like 'Illinois')

school_name.description: Name of the school or university (optional)

borrow_amount.description: Amount needed to pay for school (dollar amount without formatting, e.g., 30000)

expected_salary.description: Expected yearly salary after completing program (dollar amount without formatting, e.g., 55000)

income_growth_rate.description: Expected annual income growth rate as a percentage (e.g., 3 for 3%, default is 3)

current_loans.description: NEW loans to simulate borrowing (required: at least 1 loan, often 2-3 loans). NOT existing loans - this is the loan mix you want to borrow to cover the borrow_amount. YOU MUST CONSTRUCT THIS ARRAY - do not ask the user for loan types. For dependent undergrads needing more than $5,500: ALWAYS include Direct Subsidized (up to limit), Direct Unsubsidized (up to limit), and Direct PLUS Loan for Parents (unlimited, fills remaining gap). For independent/grad students: use Direct Graduate Unsubsidized + Direct PLUS Loan for Graduate/Professionals. The sum of all loan_balance values MUST equal borrow_amount exactly. Use current federal interest rates from $comment field above.

loan_type.description: Type of student loan - MUST match FSA dropdown options exactly. BORROWING LIMITS: 'Direct Subsidized Loan' (Freshman: $3,500 max, Sophomore: $4,500, Jr/Sr: $5,500, rate: 5.50%), 'Direct Unsubsidized Loan' undergrad (Dependent Fresh: +$2,000 max additional, Soph: +$2,000, Jr/Sr: +$2,000, rate: 6.53%), 'Direct Graduate Unsubsidized Loan' (Grad: $20,500/year max, rate: 8.08%), 'Direct PLUS Loan for Parents' (UNLIMITED up to cost minus other aid, rate: 9.08% - USE THIS to fill gaps beyond direct student loan limits), 'Direct PLUS Loan for Graduate/Professionals' (UNLIMITED, rate: 9.08%), 'Private Loan' (varies, rate: 8-12%). For dependent undergrads borrowing >$5,500: You MUST include Parent PLUS loan.

loan_interest_rate.description: Interest rate as a percentage (e.g., 5.5 for 5.5%). USE CURRENT FEDERAL RATES (2024-25): Direct Subsidized=5.50%, Direct Unsubsidized (undergrad)=6.53%, Direct Graduate Unsubsidized=8.08%, Direct PLUS (parent/grad)=9.08%, Private=8-12% (varies). These rates are documented in the $comment field at the top of this schema.

loan_balance.description: Loan amount to borrow (dollar amount without formatting, e.g., 10000). For federal loans, respect annual borrowing limits documented in loan_type field. CRITICAL: The sum of all loan_balance values across all items in the current_loans array MUST equal borrow_amount exactly.
